en: Allow reopening same file or folder

- Parser for various other resource files
- Additional info and research into +R
Show a colored rectangle behind the sprite, extending to its dimensions
Replace the embedded palette with an import.
Export the embedded palette to a file...
Open the embedded palette editor and enable changes
The way in which sprites will be placed once imported.

The method used for placing sprites.
Append: add sprites at the end. Existing sprites are not affected.
Replace: replaces as many sprites as are being imported, starting at the set position. Excess sprites are appended.
Insert: inserts sprites at the set position. Sprites that come after will be moved, affecting existing cells.
What position to replace/insert sprites at.
Waiting for files to be selected.

Will not replace sprites.
Total sprites after import: {total}

Will REPLACE {replace} sprite(s)!
Total sprites after import: {total}

Will not displace sprites.
Total sprites after import: {total}

Will DISPLACE {displace} sprite(s)!
Total sprites after import: {total}
Set how to handle the palettes of imported sprites here.

Whether to include the palette of imported sprites.
Embedded palettes are ignored by 'Player' sprites, but required by everything else.
If the input sprite has a palette, this setting will halve its alpha channel (transparency) values.
Configure additional processing to apply to imported sprites here.

If checked, sprites will be treated as RGB images,
and the color index of each pixel will be obtained
from its red channel, rather than the input pixel's
actual color index.
Whether to reindex input sprites, changing the order of their color groups from 1-2-3-4 to 1-3-2-4 or vice-versa.

Whether to modify the bit depth of imported sprites (note that resulting depth will always be at least 4 bpp).
No change: bit depth will be left as-is.
Force 4-bit: bit depth will be brought down to 4 bpp (16 colors) if higher.
Force 8-bit: bit depth will be brought up to 8 bpp (256 colors) if lower.
Sets the imported sprite to preview.
Sets the palette to preview sprites with.

The file was not found or is not a valid sprite.
{file}
Click to begin importing sprites with the above settings.

Select the range of sprites to export here.
To export only one sprite, set both boxes to the same value.
Sets the starting sprite of the export range.
Sets the ending sprite of the export range.

Select formats to export to here.
Nothing will be exported unless you select at least one.

Exports a binary sprite in the same format it is found in in the game's files.
Supports palettes with transparency.
Analogous to extracting sprites with a hex editor.

Export an uncompressed binary sprite.
Supports palettes with transparency.
These work in game, but are not recommended.
Export a RAW file that can be used as a PalMod preview.

Export an indexed PNG.
Supports palettes with transparency.

Export an indexed BMP.
Supports palettes, but not transparency.
Choose how to handle palettes for exported sprites here.
Whether to include a palette at all.
Which palette number to apply to exported sprites.

Ways in which to alter the alpha of exported sprites.
Do nothing: alpha will be left as-is.
Double: double alpha of all colors.
Halve: halve alpha of all colors.
Make opaque: turn all colors completely solid.

Reindex output sprites, changing the order of their
color groups from 1-2-3-4 to 1-3-2-4 and vice-versa.

Only applies to 8 bpp sprites.

By default, exported sprites will be named according to their original indices.
Enabling this setting will cause exported sprites to always be named 'sprite_0', 'sprite_1', 'sprite_2', etc.
Set the exported sprite to preview.
Click to begin exporting sprites with the above settings.

Select the range of sprites to delete here.
To delete only one sprite, set both boxes to the same value.
Sets the starting sprite of the range to delete.
Sets the ending sprite of the range to delete.

ON: After deleting, automatically adjust the sprite index
for cells whose sprites were displaced, so that they don't
visually change.

Cells pointing to now-deleted sprites will have their
sprite index set back to 0.

OFF: Do not adjust cells after deleting sprites. If a cell's
sprite index is still within the bounds of the sprite array,
don't change it. If it's out of bounds, clamp it.
Click to delete sprites with the above settings.
Use this preview to check what sprites will be deleted.

Cannot delete all sprites! Object needs at least 1.
Consider importing new sprites to replace the old ones.
Delete a single cell or a range of cells.

Add a new cell before the current one.
Displaces cells after it!

Add a new cell after the current one.
Displaces cells after it!
Copy the current cell to the clipboard.

Paste the cell in the clipboard as a new cell before the current one.
Displaces cells after it!

Paste the cell in the clipboard as a replacement to the current one.
Does not displace cells.

Paste the cell in the clipboard as a new cell after the current one.
Displaces cells after it!
Selects a cell to view or modify.

Selects which cell to display an onion skin in the preview for.
Set this to '-1' to disable the onion skin.
Toggles whether the onion skin should appear behind or in front of the current cell's sprite.
These values control how cells display sprites.
Controls which sprite number this cell will display in game.

Controls the sprite's horizontal offset for this cell.
Click to change the control type.

Controls the sprite's vertical offset for this cell.
Click to change the control type.
Flips type 6 sprite cutouts vertically as the mode 1 VISUAL instruction does.

This section controls the boxes for this cell.
Modifying them will cause desyncs in online matches and old replays!

Toggles whether to display boxes at all.
They can't be edited while hidden.

Toggles box editing on/off.
Editing boxes will cause desyncs in online matches and old replays!
Controls which types of boxes will be displayed in the preview.
The list of boxes contained in this cell.
Sets the type of selected boxes.
Sets the selected box's horizontal offset.
Sets the selected box's vertical offset.
Moves the cropped sprite region to the right, 8 pixels at a time.
Moves the cropped sprite region down, 8 pixels at a time.
Set the palette to preview sprites with.
Saves the current cell as an image to Gear Studio's install path, under 'snapshots'.

Click: Select colors
Shift + click: Add to selection
Shift + right click: Remove from selection
CTRL + C: Copy
CTRL + V: Paste
CTRL: Preview paste
Tab: Swap selection mode (box/range)
Escape: Clear selection
Replace the current palette with an import.
Export the current palette as an .act or .bin file.
Choose here the color to apply to the selected indexes.
Sets the sprite to preview the current palette with.

Delete the current action.
Displaces actions after it!

Add a new action before the current one.
Displaces actions after it!

Add a new action after the current one.
Displaces actions after it!
Copy the current action to the clipboard.

Paste the action in the clipboard as a new action before the current one.
Displaces actions after it!

Paste the action in the clipboard as a replacement to the current one.
Does not displace actions.

Paste the action in the clipboard as a new action after the current one.
Displaces actions after it!
Selects an action to view or modify.
This section holds the action's basic properties: damage and flags.
Damage dealt by this action on hit.
Various action properties. Their functionality is unknown at this time.
Can be blocked in the air
This section holds the action's instructions (the list of functions to run, in order) and allows modifying them.

Delete the current instruction.
Displaces instructions after it!

Add a new instruction of the selected type before the current one.
Displaces instructions after it!

Add a new instruction of the selected type after the current one.
Displaces instructions after it!
Copy the current instruction to the clipboard.

Paste the instruction in the clipboard as a new instruction before the current one.
Displaces instructions after it!

Paste the instruction in the clipboard as a replacement to the current one.
Does not displace instructions.

Paste the instruction in the clipboard as a new instruction after the current one.
Displaces instructions after it!
Click to select the type of new instructions.
This section allow modifying an instruction's parameters.
Select an instruction from the above list in order to view and modify its parameters.
Stops "VISUAL" effects from being applied to the preview.
WARNING: This part of Gear Studio is incomplete, and may not correctly mirror in-game behavior.
Select an image to replace the cursor mask with.
Save the current cursor mask as an indexed PNG image.
Opens the preview options side panel.

Select which palette to use in the preview.
Affects reference files.
Toggles display of this object's hitboxes in the preview.
Which open tab to draw reference objects from.
Which object from the selected session to use as a reference.
Sets a specific cell to use as a static reference.
Toggles displaying the reference in front of the main preview.
Toggles display of the reference object's hitboxes.
Toggles displaying the reference at half transparency.
Unable to load, file invalid or unsupported.
ERROR! Could not save. Cause: no path.
ERROR! Could not save. Cause: no path. Try "Save as..."
The Action History is not currently available.
Already at min zoom, centered view.
Could not load palette, file is invalid or does not exist.
Script instruction database build complete. Entries: {count}.
No cell on clipboard, nothing pasted.
No sprite info on clipboard, nothing pasted.
No boxes on clipboard, nothing pasted.
Nothing selected. Palette has not been modified.
Could not apply palette, no sprite selected.
Cannot delete all actions! Nothing done.
No actions on clipboard, nothing pasted.
No instructions on clipboard, nothing pasted.
Cell #{index}: Set type for multiple boxes
Cell #{index}: Set sprite region x offset
Cell #{index}: Set sprite region y offset
